did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.unittitle: J. Walter Thompson Company. New Business records 1924-2006 and undated, bulk 1980-1989
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Founded in 1864, the J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) is one of the largest and oldest enduring advertising companies in the United States.

The J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) New Business Records span the years 1924-2006, with the bulk of materials spanning 1980-1989. The collection combines the records of the New Business Departments of JWT's major U.S. offices: New York, Chicago, Detroit, Atlanta, and San Francisco, and includes presentations, memoranda, case histories, market research, and profiles of companies, industries, market segments, products and product categories. Topics addressed include the youth market, financial services marketing, food and grocery marketing, feminine hygiene and other personal products, and product branding. The collection includes photographs, audiocassettes, videocassettes, DVDs. Over 300 companies are represented in the collection, including Alitalia, Baskin-Robbins, Bell Atlantic, Circuit City, Eastern Airlines, Eyelab, Frito-Lay, Goodyear, Häagen-Dazs, HBO, Hyatt Hotels, IBM, Johnson & Johnson, Kodak, Kraft, Miller Beer, Morgan Stanley, Nabisco, Nestlé, Prudential, Schering-Plough, and the U.S. Navy. Many of the companies represented in the collection subsequently became clients of JWT, so there is some correlation between this collection and the JWT Account Files collection. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising, & Marketing History.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Materials are closed to non-JWT researchers for 15 years from date of creation. Materials containing sensitive information relating to employment or other personnel issues are closed to non-JWT researchers for 40 years from the date of termination of employment, or 25 years from the date of the death of the employee.
Original audiovisual materials are closed to researchers until Use Copies can be produced. Contact Research Services staff for more information.
In addition, the Collection may contain materials to which the Acknowledgement of Legal Responsibilities and Privacy Rights form applies. Patrons must sign this form before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], J. Walter Thompson Company. New Business Records, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The J. Walter Thompson Company. New Business Records were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 1987, with additions throughout subsequent years.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Jessica Wood, Katie-Rose Repp, and Richard Collier.
Encoded by Katie-Rose Repp and Richard Collier.
Descriptive sources and standards used to create this inventory: DACS, EAD, NCEAD guidelines, and local Style Guide.
This finding aid is NCEAD compliant.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) New Business Records span the years 1924-2006, with the bulk of materials spanning 1980-1989. The collection combines the records of the New Business Departments of JWT's major U.S. offices: New York, Chicago, Detroit, Atlanta, and San Francisco, and includes presentations, memoranda, case histories, market research, and profiles of companies, industries, market segments, products and product categories. Topics addressed include the youth market, financial sservices marketing, food and grocery marketing, feminine hygiene and other personal products, and product branding. The collection includes photographs, audiocassettes, videocassettes, DVDs. Over 300 companies are represented in the collection, including Alitalia, Baskin-Robbins, Bell Atlantic, Circuit City, Eastern Airlines, Eyelab, Frito-Lay, Goodyear, Häagen-Dazs, HBO, Hyatt Hotels, IBM, Johnson & Johnson, Kodak, Kraft, Miller Beer, Morgan Stanley, Nabisco, Nestlé, Prudential, Schering-Plough, and the U.S. Navy. Many of the companies represented in the collection subsequently became clients of JWT, so there is some correlation between this collection and the JWT Account Files collection.

arrangement.head: Collection Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is arranged into 6 series: General Files; Company Files; Product Category Files; Oversize Materials; Audiovisual Materials; and Restricted Materials. The General Files series includes aggregate information about JWT's client base by year, gains and losses of clients; various account and new business prospect reports; biographical sketches of executives working in new business activities; and the files of some executives engaged in new business activities, including Richard Brecker and Milton Moskowitz. The Company Files series includes materials organized alphabetically by company or product name; over 300 companies are represented. The Product Category Files series includes mainly research reports on broad product and industry categories maintained by New Business Department. Oversize Materials consist of large-format materials segregated from the main body of files due to size constraints. Audiovisual Materials consist of moving image and audio materials. Restricted Materials consists of materials not currently open to general researchers. Original folder titles have been maintained.

controlaccess.head: Subject Headings
controlaccess.p: These are searchable subject entries for this collection. Performing a search on these subjects in the Duke University Libraries online catalog will bring up other related research materials.

scopecontent.p: Includes aggregate information about JWT's client base by year, gains and losses of clients; various account and new business prospect reports; biographical sketches of executives working in new business activities; and the files of some executives engaged in new business activities, including Richard Brecker and Milton Moskowitz. Oversize and Restricted materials have been physically relocated to their respective series and noted in the their logical location by an entry in brackets. Arranged alphabetically by topic.

scopecontent.p: Includes presentations, printed materials, clippings, background research reports; strategy and position papers. Oversize and Restricted materials have been physically relocated to their respective series and noted in the their logical location by an entry in brackets. Original folder titles have been retained. Arranged alphabetically by company or product, thereunder by topic.
